title: Strange Lands
opening: Ike and company break the siege of Delbray Castle and join ranks with the Crimean retainers therein. The army grows to its largest size yet, and with the addition of the retainers, truly becomes the armed force of its name. In addition, their recent heroic acts finally move the conservative Gallians to dispatch much-needed reinforcements.

The long-waited warriors of Gallia march through the treacherous Marhaut mountain range, a series of jagged peaks that spread across  southern Crimea. They then slip through the gaps in the Daein forces and move toward Crimea's army. Gallia rises. This information emboldens Ike, and he marches the army at top speed to join their new allies.

intro.speaker: Unknown
intro.line: Leanne! I'm coming in.

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: (King Tibarn!)

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: How are you feeling?

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: (Today I am feeling most splendid.)

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Ah, it is good to hear that you are well. Not surprising--it is a beautiful day!

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: (I am growing used to the smell of the sea.)

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Yes, we hawks enjoy the smell of the sea as well. Then you are starting to feel more at home here? Good, good. And how is Lord Lorazieh?

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: (...Unchanged......)

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Hm... I had thought his condition might have improved. Well, let's hope for a brighter tomorrow.

intro.speaker: Lotz
intro.line: You can understand what the heron princess is saying, can't you, Your Majesty?

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Hm? Yes. Well, some of it, at least. Oh, you weren't around when Reyson first got here, were you, Lotz? When he arrived, he was just like this. You'd never know it by how fluently he speaks our modern tongue, would you?

intro.speaker: Lotz
intro.line: Now that you mention it, he does use some funny words when he gets angry. But, the letter that just arrived is written in standard script, isn't it?

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Over these twenty years, he's gained total mastery of...You...you read the letter, didn't you?!

intro.speaker: Lotz
intro.line: N-no, I just caught a glimpse of it in your hand. That's all. I'm sorry! Er...Your Majesty...

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: You little scamp...

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: (A letter?)

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Hm? Yes, that's right. It's a letter from Reyson. It appears the Crimean army has passed safely through Daein and is on its way to the homeland.

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: (What good news! So he's doing well, isn't he?)

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Yes, Reyson is fine, but... I wonder what happened. He doesn't give details, but he asks Phoenicis to send reinforcements.

intro.speaker: Lotz
intro.line: If Prince Reyson is asking for help, things must be fairly serious.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: I'd like nothing better than to take wing immediately, but I can't leave Lord Lorazieh and Leanne here alone...

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: (I'll go with you!)

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: No, that won't work.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Don't try that look on me. There's no way I'm taking you with me.

intro.speaker: Lotz
intro.line: Yeah, that's crazy talk!

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: (...Big meanie!!)

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: I suppose it's time to put my plan into action.

intro.speaker: Lotz
intro.line: What is it?

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: (Plan?)

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: All right, I'm off to Gallia to get things settled. Lotz, I want you to watch over Leanne and help her pack.

intro.speaker: Lotz
intro.line: Yes, sir!

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: (Please put that cloth in here.)

intro.speaker: Lotz
intro.line: Um, I... I don't have any idea what you're trying to say. Maybe I should talk louder...

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: (Tee hee! You're not very smart! I wasnt you to take this. and put it in here.)

intro.speaker: Lotz
intro.line: Um, DO YOU WANT ME... TO PUT THIS...IN THAT BAG??

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: (Yes, yes.)

intro.speaker: Lotz
intro.line: Got it! In it goes! I'm getting the hang of this. I'M PUTTING IT IN THE BAG!

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: (Ah! Aaaaahhhh!!!)

intro.speaker: Lotz
intro.line: What? Is something wrong?

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: (Who's there!?)

intro.speaker: Lotz
intro.line: What are you...? Over there? Behind me? WHAT? SOMEONE IS BEHIND ME?? Gwaaaa!!!

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: (Lotz! No! Let him go!)

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: If you want your father to be killed, then by all means keep screaming.

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: (...Brother...)

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: Ah! The prodigal son returns!

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: I have gained that which you requested.

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: Show me.

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: This way.

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: These heron royals all look alike, don't they? Perhaps it proves their bloodline, but it's unsettling how similar they are.

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: I believe you had one in your possession previously.

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: Yes, I tried to get her to free the dark god from the medallion, but all she did was get sick and die. Pah! They're ridiculously frail creatures. I should have just killed her in the first place and saved some time.

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: Might I suggest this one be treated with more care? Capturing her was not an easy task.

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: For you, it did take quite a long time...Didn't it?

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: Diverting the sharp eyes of the hawk king proved to be quite difficult. It required much planning and care.

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: Ha! Don't tell me it was difficult! I know you! I know you use that arcane powder to travel about at will.

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: The powder drains my strength. For that reason, I would rather not use it unless absolutely necessary.

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: You are an enigma, dark one. Everything you possess is fey and of unknown origin.

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: The armor I presented to you...Do you find it dissatisfactory?

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: No, it has my approval. My wyvern Rajaion, and this armor which renders any enemy attack impotent... Both are well suited to me. They both shine because they are mine! And now the medallion, and that galdr as well, both belong in my hands!

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: Will the revival of the dark god take place soon?

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: Let me see... The conditions aren't bad. But, how long will they continue...Har! It is no matter. As long as all my chess pieces are on the board, things will work out. Soon every knee will bow to Ashnard!

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: ...What is going on? What's happened here?

intro.speaker: Lotz
intro.line: M-my...king...

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Lotz! Hold on!

intro.speaker: Lotz
intro.line: I'm...so...sorry......the...princess......

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Who did this? Who was the craven dastard that did this to you?

intro.speaker: Lotz
intro.line: ...Knight...in...black armor...Gwaa...urrk!

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Lotz! No! Curse you, Daein! This was evilly done! Well, if you think to play such a game, you'll not find me an easy mark!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Ranulf! Whereabouts is the Gallian army encamped?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Just over those mountains.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: So we're finally going to join forces...

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Reports say that King Ashnard is gathering his forces in the capital. The time to work together is certainly upon us.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Ike! There's an enemy ambush waiting for us on that mountain.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Mmm... If we go around that mountain and avoid it, how much time will we lose?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: A couple of days, at least.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: In that case, we've no choice but to go through them, right?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Agreed.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Um, wait a second... Isn't this where there's usually some sort of discussion? Hello?

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: The enemy approaches, sir.

intro.speaker: Gromell
intro.line: Listen up, men! Let them get as close as possible before pushing the rocks over the cliff. We must not let Crimea join forces with those sub-humans!

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Commander, the foes are encamped on top of the rise. I wonder what sort of trap they have this time.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Those boulders didn't get up there all by themselves... Are they seriously going to roll them down on us?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: At first glance, it seems a simplistic trap, but these narrow paths make avoiding the rocks impossible. I think they may be surprisingly effective.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: So...

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: We run up the mountain as quickly as possible and smash the enemy commander! Right?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Right... How did you--

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: I know...genius.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Actually, that is the best plan. Try to avoid the boulders and reach the top as quickly as possible. Once there, defeat the general.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Right. Move out!

boss.speaker: Gromell
boss.line: Grr! So you've made it this far, have you? Then prepare to be sent down screaming!

boss.speaker: Gromell
boss.line: Heh heh...ha ha ha...Gather as many fools as you like...your weakness cannot survive...No one on this earth can withstand the might...of our king...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Is this the lot of them?

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: It looked like there were more of them from down there.

end.speaker: Daein Soldier
end.line: Now we've got you! Eat rock! Heh...eat rock... I'm pretty clever...

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Above us! Look out!

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: Need a hand?

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Tibarn! You came!

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: Well met, Reyson. And well met to the rest of you as well, warriors of Crimea.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: How did you come to be here?

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: I thought I'd help you wipe out Daein.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: That's good news for us, but has something happened? Why did you suddenly decide to help?

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: I asked for his aid. We must defeat King Daein. To that end, the more powerful we are, the better. Yes?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: So that's the story, is it?

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: It's true that Reyson requested my aid. However, that's not the only reason that I'm here.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Hm? What is it?

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: In a moment. First, let us meet with the king of lions. He waits for us at the foot of the mountain.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Understood. Come on, everyone! Let's get off this peak and take a rest at the bottom.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: King Caineghis! It's an honor to see you again.

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: First, let me offer you my congratulations. You've made quite the triumphant return, Princess Elincia.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Thank you. And allow me to express my gratitude for having the kingdom of Gallia fighting at our side. Your presence fills me with strength.

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: During this short interim, you've managed to turn the tide of the war. To be honest, I'm quite surprised.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: I didn't...I didn't come this far on my own. My lord Ike and his brave companions were with me. It was only with the support of many that I was able to return home.

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Yes, my reports cover most of that. Everything that happened in Begnion, and in Daein as well.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: As to that... About Nasi--

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: King Gallia! Princess Crimea! I apologize for interrupting the festivities, but there's something I must discuss with you. Would you gather over there?

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: This group contains the people who were at the heart of that last battle, correct?

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Yes, it is.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: What about those two children? Surely they weren't involved.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: ...Children?

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Um...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: This is Soren. He's my tactician.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: And this is my sister, Mist. Before we begin this war council, there's something I need to share with all of you...It's a story that involves my parents as well. I've kept most of it from my sister, but I felt this would be a good chance for her to hear it, so I asked her to join us.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: Understood. Go on.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: It all begins when we meet Princess Elincia and escorted her into the forests of Gallia...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: And that is everything I know.

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: F-Father...he... Is that how...Mom? That's...not true, is it?

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Mist... Do you want to leave?

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Um... No...I'm all right. I'm all right...I'm just a little confused.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Mist...

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: That's the whole of it, eh?

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: So this wasn't ever just a dispute between Crimea and Daein... There was something else at play the entire time.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: What could King Ashnard's ultimate goal possibly be? He has risked everything, even surrendering his own country...

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Twenty years ago, even before he became king, he tried to release the dark god from within the medallion. However, he was thwarted by the actions of Greil and Elena.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: What manner of being is this dark god? What would happen if it were freed from its prison?

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: I fear the world would once again be beset by natural calamity--much like it was 800 years ago. At that time, all the world, save Tellius, was drowned beneath the seas.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: That is a true story? I thought it nothing more than a fable...

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: We have living proof: Goldoa's King Deghinsea. He and two other heroes fought alongside the goddess herself to defeat the dark one.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: King Goldoa was one of the legendary heroes? But he's...still alive...

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: The Black Dragon King is a living fossil, and as stubborn as anything alive. He's been trying to control the rest of us for years, and he always says the same thing. Do not fan the flames of strife. As long as Lehran's medallion exists, you must never begin a war that engulfs the entire continent.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: ...Never begin a war? It's possible...Perhaps there is more than one way for the dark god to gain its freedom.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: Oh ho! Aren't you the clever one? That's just what the Black Dragon King says. Yet, the truth of that is unknown. There's a war going on right now, but the dark god's nowhere in sight, is it?

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: ...Could it be...? I think I may finally know Ashnard's intentions.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Really?

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: King Goldoa said that a conflict which engulfs the entire continent would free the dark god from the medallion. Let us assume that the war would have such an effect on the medallion no matter where it was...or who possessed it. And let's also assume that the king of Daein thinks this as well. I can hear him now...Where is the tinder for the blaze I need? The answer to this question proved to be an easy one. Yet he had to find a way to test his theory...So, he attacked neighboring Crimea. It had to be Crimea. Begnion was too big, too powerful. Daein would have lost. Crimea, however, is a country known more for its scholarship than its military strength. Daein probably felt that a surprise invasion would let them win while taking minimal casualties themselves. And they were right. Crimea was easy prey.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: King Ramon was also friendly toward laguz...I imagine that this, too, influenced Daein's decision. If things went well, the conflict would be enough to engulf Crimea's ally, Gallia, and the fires would spread. First Crimea, then Gallia...And eventually Begnion as well. Daein's power would increase, and strife and discord would spread across the land, eventually reaching the lost medallion.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: So you believe King Daein's goal is to awaken the dark god after all?

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: At the very least, it is one of his ambitions. There can be no mistaking that.

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Which means that our plan to attack him at the capital fits right into his strategy, doesn't it? It's the trigger he needs to break the dark god's bonds.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: Even if that's true, we can't stop now. This war's gone too far for that.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: We have to smash Daein to end its menace once and for all. We bury every one of them and finish it.

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Mmm... Agreed. That's the only plan that makes any sense.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: If only we had the medallion with us...

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: What is it, Reyson? Is there a way to avoid all of this?

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: We, that is, the descendants of Lehran, we have a gift...Through the power of the slumber galdr, we have the ability to suppress the chaotic energies of the dark god in the medallion. So even if a massive battle occurred, if it were in my possession, I might be able to...

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: I'm so sorry! It's because of my carelessness that the medallion was lost in the first place!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Mist! I told you that it wasn't your fault, didn't I?

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: But--

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: You were never careless, Mist. I know. You kept the medallion next to you at all times. You told me it was a keepsake of your mother's, and you always, always took good care of it. Didn't you?

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: That's why it's not your fault. So please don't punish yourself anymore. All right?

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Princess Elincia...

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: She's right. And besides, the dark god could be released no matter where the medallion is. So it's nothing to worry about.

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Thank you, Ranulf.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: All right... It's about time for you to hear what I have to say. Reyson!

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Yes?

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: I'm sorry.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Huh? F-for what?

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: Leanne's been kidnapped. It may have been by Daein's hand.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: That...can't be...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Why would Leanne be taken? The release galdr can only be sung by the girl Altina. Right?

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: But Ashnard doesn't know that.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Oh no...

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: What a mess... Nothing can ever be clear and simple, can it?

conversation.speaker: Boy
conversation.line: Mister! 'Scuse me, mister! Are you guys gonna go into these mountains? There are lots of soldiers wearing black up there. Those guys...they killed my poppa and burned our village. That's why we went to the mountains in the first place. You're gonna go up there and take care of 'em, aren't you? Gonna make 'em pay? Please, mister, say that you are! My momma and my sister and me don't have anywhere else to go, and I wanna go back to the cabin my poppa built.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I understand. We're going to take care of those guys. You just stay here a bit longer. All right?

conversation.speaker: Boy
conversation.line: Yay! Go give 'em heck, mister! Oh, wait! Wait! I heard those guys talking about something, too! They said if anyone comes up the mountain single file, they'd get 'em all at once. It was something like that anyway.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Really? That's a lot of help. Thanks.

conversation.speaker: Boy
conversation.line: Good luck, mister!! Kill 'em all! Do it for my poppa!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Excuse me, do you have a moment?

conversation.speaker: Bastian
conversation.line: Forsooth! What ho! My eyes behold Sir Ike! Pray tell, what would you ask of me, good sir?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Um...well... I just wanted to chat. I try to speak with all the members of the army when I have a minute.

conversation.speaker: Bastian
conversation.line: I see! A fine idea that is, good sir. Some generals hope their soldiers all to be aloof, and ready always for the fight. If all goes well, sweet happiness abounds. But if the tides do turn, then anger grows. One wonders if he can lead men at all...I, too, am often plagued by such grim thoughts.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Uh...yeah. Listen, I--

conversation.speaker: Bastian
conversation.line: Yet you walk out among your men-at-arms; spin tales, tell jokes, and lend a willing ear. Huzzah, dear sir! Huzzah until the end! In truth, I did much fear your name at first. I swore to find the mettle of the man, and studied you with cautious, steady eye. I thought to find yourself a brutish rogue. A villain crafty in his fiendish plans! With status and great wealth his only goals. Had such been your own ethic and deceit, I would have taken measures sure and swift to see your person vanished in the night. Yet lo! What do I find before mine eyes? A man so noble, true, and without peer, as would beset the moon herself with lust!

conversation.speaker: Bastian
conversation.line: General?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Zzz...Wha--? Huh? ...Er... Sorry about that. Must have dozed off. What were you saying? Something about the moon or...something?

conversation.speaker: Bastian
conversation.line: Commander, you are tired and unaware of how your body doth cry out for rest. If it would please you, I was of a mind to partake in a sweet and soothing draught. A beverage warm, and pleasant to the lips.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: ...Um, if you're offering me a cup of tea in your tent, I'll accept. ...That IS what you're offering... Right? Oh, and I apologize in advance if I fall asleep again. I'm really tired.

conversation.speaker: Bastian
conversation.line: Your words do make my ears alive with joy! I shall regale you with a tale or two, and poems to ease the savage toll of war.

conversation.speaker: Largo
conversation.line: Hey there, little man! I've got serious business with the general of this army. Take a message, will ya?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: And you would be...?

conversation.speaker: Largo
conversation.line: The name's Largo, and I'm a world-class berserker!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: World-class berserker... That's a rather dubious title.

conversation.speaker: Largo
conversation.line: What's this? You doubting my strength? I can pin a tiger with my bare hands! That's not just hot air either!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Dubious.

conversation.speaker: Largo
conversation.line: You think I'm fooling with you? Have your general hire me and then see for yourself! You can decide how much I'm worth after you see me in action. But let me tell you, if the gold's not good enough, pffft! I'm gone!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Huh? All of this sounds vaguely familiar...But at least you're confident.

conversation.speaker: Largo
conversation.line: Like I said. World-class berserker. Here, watch me bend this lance. Rrrrrrrrrr!!!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: All right. You're in.

conversation.speaker: Largo
conversation.line: Yes! So, uh, how about taking me to meet the general?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I'm the general.

conversation.speaker: Largo
conversation.line: Wah? Bwaa ha ha ha ha ha haaaaa! That's good! You're a funny little guy! Bwaa ha ha ha haaaa!! So, seriously. Where's the general's tent? Must be that big one there.

conversation.speaker: Unknown
conversation.line: Largo?

conversation.speaker: Largo
conversation.line: Hey! I thought I'd find you here, Calill! You're looking hot! Almost as hot as me! Bwaaa ha ha ha haaaaaa!

conversation.speaker: Calill
conversation.line: Did you come looking for little old me? Oh, how sad for you. My contract with this army isn't up for quite some time.

conversation.speaker: Largo
conversation.line: Yeah, I thought you'd say that. That's why I'm joining up, too!

conversation.speaker: Calill
conversation.line: What? Are you really going to hire Largo, General Ike?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: That's the plan.

conversation.speaker: Largo
conversation.line: Huh? This little guy really is the general? Bwa ha ha ha! Don't I look like the biggest fool around? And I mean big! Rrrrrrr! Sorry if I offended you, little guy!

conversation.speaker: Calill
conversation.line: Oh... He's such a clown. But you made a good hire. After all, he's a world-class--

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Berserker. Yeah, I heard.

conversation.speaker: Calill
conversation.line: He pinned a tiger with his bare hands! Two of them, actually. At the same time.

conversation.speaker: Largo
conversation.line: Bwa ha ha ha haaaaa! Yeah, that was awesome!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: ...Definitely dubious...
